page.title: 01GAZETTEER
page.content: The area surveyed by our group contains two villages - Slimbridge and Cambridge - several farms and one or two places of interest. The land is fairly flat and low-lying although there are one or two small hills. Bordering the Severn Estuary as it does, the area is prone to the various climactic variations which accompany the changing tides and also to the sometimes severe winds that blow up from the Bristol Channel. The main A 38 Trunk Road from Bristol to Gloucester runs straight through the area and this road still carries a considerable volume of traffic in spite of the building of the M5 Motorway which runs parallel to the road for many miles. The village of Slimbridge is mentioned in the original Domesday Survey as Heflinbruge with land
